Interactive taxon matching using WoRMS

Source: R/worms_api_functions.R
match_worms_taxa_interactive.Rd

This function matches a vector of scientific names against the World Register of Marine Species (WoRMS) taxon database. It allows the user to interactively resolve cases where multiple matches are found.

Usage

match_worms_taxa_interactive(names, ask = TRUE)

Arguments

names

Character vector of scientific names to match.

ask

Logical; if TRUE (default), the user is prompted to resolve multiple matches interactively.

Value

A data.frame with the following columns:

scientificName

The matched scientific name from WoRMS.

scientificNameID

The unique WoRMS identifier (LSID) for the matched name.

match_type

Type of match returned by WoRMS (e.g., exact, fuzzy).

acceptedNameUsageID

WoRMS AphiaID of the currently accepted taxon name.

Details

The function queries WoRMS in batches to improve efficiency. For names that return multiple matches, the user can inspect the matches and select the correct one. If ask = FALSE, the function will not prompt the user, and ambiguous names will be returned as NA.

The function has been modified from the obistools package (Provoost and Bosch, 2024).

References

Provoost P, Bosch S (2024). “obistools: Tools for data enhancement and quality control” Ocean Biodiversity Information System. Intergovernmental Oceanographic Commission of UNESCO. R package version 0.1.0, https://iobis.github.io/obistools/.

See also

  • WoRMS website

  • worrms R package on CRAN

  • match_worms_taxa() to match taxa names non-interactively.

  • obistools R package

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
names <- c("Aurelia aurita", "Mnemiopsis leidyi", "Unknown species")
# Interactive mode (default)
match_worms_taxa_interactive(names)

# Non-interactive mode
match_worms_taxa_interactive(names, ask = FALSE)
} # }
